comment.author: 49015875@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bashka_Paeff Paeff was born in Minsk, Russia, but immigrated to the United States as an infant. In 1914 she attended the School of the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, where she studied with Bela Pratt, and was sometimes called the "Subway sculptor" because she worked at Boston's Park Street T station. Later she worked at the MacDowell Colony, and subsequently married Samuel Montefiore Waxman, Professor of Romance Languages at Boston University.
